wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Hamilton Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet,  (16 November 1907 – 8 December 1989) was a British politician and industrialist.

response: * Sir John Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet (1907–1989), politician and industrialist
* Sir John Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet (1907–1989), British politician and industrialist

Wedgwood was the eldest son of Sir John Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet.  He was a great-great-great-great-grandson of the master potter Josiah Wedgwood. Sir Martin was educated at Eton and Trinity College, Oxford.http://www.burkespeerage.com/Search/FullRecord.aspx?ID=14402 Over the course of his life, Wedgwood mastered 20 languages.

Tudor-Craig was born in Suffolk in 1960. She is the only daughter of James Tudor-Craig, son of Sir Algernon Tudor-Craig. Her mother is the mediaeval art historian Pamela, Lady Wedgwood, (née Wynne-Reeves). When Tudor-Craig's father died in 1969, the family moved from Suffolk to London, where her mother remained unmarried for the next 13 years. In 1982, she married Sir John Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet, of the Wedgwood pottery family, but was again widowed in 1989.

* Arthur's nephew and Clement's grandson, Sir John Wedgwood, 2nd Baronet, was commissioned into the 41st (5th North Staffs) AA Bn in 1938 and served on the staff during World War II.London Gazette, 22 November 1938. (There were two other Wedgwoods among the officers of 41 S/L Rgt on the eve of World War II.)
